WorkItem.Description:
Numerous items have the exact same name but several different ilvl versions and it's only getting worse as they add more gear but try to keep the number of names and item models down.
 
We can already mouse over an item and get info about ilvl and where it's from.
 
To speed this operation up and take away the need to mouseover, just include the ilvl after the name of the item in most lists, like the Upgrade and the right-hand pane in the main window.
WorkItem.Summary: [Feature Request.Items] ilvl after name in lists

Comments.Message: There's no room for that right now
Agreed that alot of names are already clipped in default view. Resizing the window will allow people to see full names though.

Put the number before the title of the item. Or even just an H for heroic.

(H) Thassarian's Gauntlets of T
is better than
Thassarian's Gauntlets of Triumph (258)
which is much better than
Thassarian's Gauntlets of Triumph *mouseover tooltip* item level 258

Honestly I'd be much happier if I only had to mouseover to see the full item name for something with a long title, rather than every time I try to find a piece of Heroic gear. It's particuarly annoying while using the item set comparison tool, where you have to go and pick out every item by name.

Agreed. The majority of posters and developers here are raiders, and many of them are geared well. The majority of Rawr users though, are probably like me and have to scroll down a few pages to see the gear they're using quite often.
